name: The Westin Resort Nusa Dua, Bali

reviews.text: We stayed at Westin Nusa Dua Resort in December 2007 around Christmas. It is indeed a great hotel and deserves its five-star ranking. However one thing I want to point out is that it should be prepared for "rainy" days. During two of the seven days we stayed there, rain was pouring down non stop for more than 48 hours. No one could go out to the beach or the outside pools, and the hotel was not equipped with enough indoor facilities to entertain its guests. Even though they opened a room in the lobby to let young children get engaged in activities like video games, there was just not enough. The two billard tables always had people lined up waiting for their turns. I hope this does not happen very often and the hotel will increase its indoor entertainment facilities. Another problem that we encountered was that the hotel employees were nice and friendly but very slow paced. We checked in after midnight because of our late flight arrival. We had to sit in the empty lobby with two tired kids for at least 45 minutes before the checkin process was completed. Service at the restaurants was also quite slow. I thought probably the hotel was intentionally being slow as they were trying to deliver a message: you are on vacation, what's the rush?
reviews.title: A nice hotel but should be prepared for rainy days

reviews.text: I have to say that our experience at the Westin over New Year was very different to some of the reviews on this site. We were extremely disappointed with the overall level of service in the hotel and whilst we took the time to meet with the Assistant Manager to raise our concerns whilst we were there, he never followed up with us.
reviews.title: Very disappointed - not up to the Westin's usual standard

reviews.text: We stayed in the family rooms which were great - good size and accommodated our two kids and my mother perfectly. Little touches like Play Station and kids board games in the room was also a nice touch.
reviews.title: A High Quality Family Resort

likes.liked: — The Relaxing and isolated environment, nothing really to do but sit by the beach and relax.
likes.disliked: — Late night music from the bar below my room, kept my kids up later than expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At check-in, which took ages, someone forgot to give us our kids packs which included cups where the children can get free drink refills throughout their stay. We only realised we were missing out on this when we noticed other kids with these cups but by that stage we had been there 5 days and had been paying! This oversight was just one of the many issues we had during our week-long stay.
reviews.title: great hotel

likes.liked: — The room and swiming pool are great
likes.disliked: — parking space too far away but they have the valet service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service in the restaurant for breakfast every morning was appalling, The maitre'd had no control over assigning tables, so people were waiting for ages for tables to be cleared and just grabbing free tables when people got up to leave, as they were tired of waiting. The queue for waffles and pancakes meant at least a 20 minute wait each morning.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Airport: Upon arrival at the airport, you have to buy a $25 pp Visa to enter the country. Once outside the airport, the taxi ticket booth is on the right side.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but not worth the $
BIG 5* Hotel
reviews.text: Money: At the airport, you have to change money to the Rupiah, as you will need taxi money. Also, during my stay here, I found that, you cannot really use the US Dollar at any stores or restaurants. The airport exchange rate was 8,950 Rupiahs for US $1. (at an exchange company in Kuta, we got about 9,130 Rupiahs for US $1). There are places that offer much higher exchange rate, but they do not mention the fees and I’ve been warned that some may try to pass off fake Rupiahs. The taxi ride to the Le Meridien cost 170,000 Rupiahs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bargaining—as an example, we were looking at buying a Bali scrap book, for photos and such. The range went as high as 200,000 to as low as 70,000, for the same item, when going to different vendors. We ended up paying 30,000 through bargaining. We also bought a fake pair of Crocs for our son. Vendors were asking as high as 100,000…we ended up paying 30,000. Taxis are also up for bargaining. A ride from Kuta to Westin in Nusa Dua started with an offer of 70,000 but quickly went down to 50,000. Bargain boldly but don’t be offensive.
reviews.title: Wouldn't Stay Again

reviews.text: Food—Food can be as cheap as US $1 per dish in some local places or as high as 70,000 for the same dish, in other places. It’s certainly cheaper than any restaurant in the US but, again, factor in the cost of the taxi to get there and back and it comes out pretty close to US prices. A lot (but not all) of local restaurants (and all hotel restaurants) add a 10% tax and 10% tip…that’s a whopping 20% added onto the bill. Warung Made restaurant has two locations, one in Kuta, near Kuta Square and the newer, bigger one in Seminyak. The food is pretty good, especially their grilled Snapper and local dishes Nasi Goreng and Mie Goreng, and fried squid in garlic sauce. The 3 of us can walk out very full for under 200,000 Rps.
reviews.title: Not Great - Not Bad

likes.disliked: — No pools that are friendly to young children.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose Bali as our Honeymoon as neither of us had been there before and we wanted to go to the Far East. Upon arrival at the airport you are required to pay $25 airport tax so be pepared for that.
reviews.title: Fantastic Honeyymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we pulled up to the Westin the entrance was awesome there were 4-5 conceirge waiting and a Balinese musician, we were offered cold flannels and a cocktail as soon as we arrived. Check in took about 10 minutes and as we were honeymooners we received a complimentry hours massage each.
reviews.title: Simply loved it!!

likes.liked: — The Heavenly Bed, 24 hour lounge and definitely the breakfast

aka: The Westin Resort Nusa Dua, Bali Hotel Nusa Dua
description: The resort features 334 sleek and sophisticated rooms and suites with a tropical edge. Guest rooms have the new generation of Heavenly® Bed, spacious 1.37 metre beds in the double-double rooms, I-pod connectivity, a bedside master switch board, and Audio Visual Entertainment port as well as ergonomically designed furnishings.
